info.game_comments:
Ben Tritle game 3.

(Sofia: Wish us bon voyage!  The Jeopardy! Clue Crew is off on a cruise--coming up next.)

(1, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew is snorkeling in the water.) The word snorkel comes from a Germanic word for this body part

(2, 1).clue: In 1889 he completed his "Self-Portrait With Bandaged Ear And Pipe"

(3, 1).clue: Those who have been whacked on this series include Jackie Jr & Big Pussy

(5, 1).clue: Born in Iowa in 1907, he starred in "Rio Lobo", "Rio Bravo" & "Rio Grande"

(6, 1).clue: A cummerbund isn't really necessary when wearing one of these

(1, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew takes her place as captain of the ship.) It's my turn to take over steering the boat or take the, this

(2, 2).clue: Painted in 1895, "Northeaster" is a well known seascape by this American artist

(3, 2).clue: This '90s horror anthology series was hosted by a talking skeleton

(5, 2).clue: Prior to marrying Roseanne, this man from Ottumwa worked as a ham packer at a Hormel plant

(6, 2).clue: In the French language, it falls between un & trois

(1, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew on a ship.) From up here this 18th century pirate, born Edward Teach is said to have spied on treasure ships

(2, 3).clue: Don't all yell at once, but it's the name of the painting seen here:

(3, 3).clue: "American Beauty" writer Alan Ball created this funeral home-set series for HBO

(5, 3).clue: Des Moines' Marilyn Maye sang 76 times, more than anyone else on the talk show of this man born in Corning

(6, 3).clue: These Indians of the northern plains had main divisions, including Santee, Yankton & Lakota

(1, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew with sharks.) Nurse sharks don't need to keep moving to breathe.  They get oxygen by pumping water over these organs

(2, 4).clue: Edouard Manet's "Olympia" was influenced in part by this famous "nudie" painting by Goya

(3, 4).clue: In 1997's "Leaving L.A." this "Boys Don't Cry" star played a technician in the coroner's office

(5, 4).clue: Iowan Meredith Willson wrote this 1957 musical set in River City, Iowa

(1, 5).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew by trees.) The roots of these saltwater trees serve as a nursery for sharks and barracuda

(2, 5).clue: Jonathan Buttall, the son of one of Gainsborough's friends, was the model for this famous painting

(3, 5).clue: Reminiscent of Jack Klugman's "Quincy" is this NBC series with Jill Hennessy as a coroner

(5, 5).clue: Burlingtonian best remembered for playing TV's Fred Mertz

(6, 5).clue: In mythology, he & his brother Castor were placed in the sky as the constellation Gemini

(1, 1).clue: About one-third of Argentina's population lives within the metropolitan area of this capital city

(4, 1).clue: Group that headlined the No Strings Attached tour

(5, 1).clue: From third base to home plate, Rickey Henderson travels this many feet

(6, 1).clue: The Latin "inter canem et lupum" literally "between dog &" this animal, refers to twilight

(1, 2).clue: Contemporary art from around the world is on display at this city's Salvador Allende Museum of Solidarity

(3, 2).clue: This novelist appropriately directed the third installment of "The Exorcist" movies

(4, 2).clue: She released 2 albums in 2000, "Mi Reflejo" & "My Kind of Christmas"

(5, 2).clue: Need to bump up your air miles total? Fly from Rio to this city's Narita airport & claim 11,000
